column1: On-Line Learning of Linear Dynamical Systems: Exponential Forgetting in Kalman Filters
Mark Kozdoba@Technion – Israel Institute of Technology
column4: Shie Mannor@Technion – Israel Institute of Technology

column1: The Kalman filter is a key tool for time-series forecasting and analysis. We show that the dependence of a prediction of Kalman filter on the past is decaying exponentially
column2: whenever the process noise is non-degenerate. Therefore
column3: Kalman filter may be approximated by regression on a few recent observations. Surprisingly
column4: we also show that having some process noise is essential for the exponential decay. With no process noise
column5: it may happen that the forecast depends on all of the past uniformly
